Crimes.Crime_Name: Making false statements to obtain immigration benefits
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of the Board's credibility assessment
Crimes.Decision_Level: Refugee Protection Division / Refugee Appeal Division
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Negative credibility finding due to contradictions and omissions
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Testimony, Personal Information Form (PIF), port of entry statements
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section 97(1) IRPA - Credibility and burden of proof
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution by PRI members in Mexico
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Inconsistencies in testimony and failure to seek state protection
Crimes.Application_Error: Omission of key details in PIF and contradictory statements
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Totality of the evidence including demeanor, consistency, plausibility
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None – court found evidence was properly assessed
Crimes.Application_Factor: Prior knowledge of threats and failure to report
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Whether the Board’s decision was reasonable
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of credibility and failure to demonstrate lack of state protection
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Contradictions between testimony and written forms
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Applicants had full opportunity to present evidence
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Omission of material facts in immigration forms
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Significant inconsistencies regarding persecutor identity and timeline
Crimes.Relevant_Law: IRPA, Charter of Rights and Freedoms (indirectly)
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to disclose key information at initial stages
Crimes.Omission_Type: Material omission in Personal Information Form

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of negative credibility finding based on contradictions
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicants provided inconsistent accounts of persecution events
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Application dismissed – no serious question raised
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Provided conflicting narratives about threats from PRI members
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of political persecution in Mexico
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Internal consistency of testimony and documentary evidence
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to maintain consistent narrative across proceedings
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Oral testimony, PIF, country condition reports
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to corroborate claims with credible evidence
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Alleged risk of harm not substantiated due to credibility issues
Crimes.Cause_Description: Threats from PRI members over political involvement
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Board entitled to weigh credibility without re-hearing
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA s. 97(1) – Burden and standard of proof
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Contradictions between oral and written statements
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: N/A – claimants were outside country of origin
Crimes.Misrepresentation_Element: Unintentional or deliberate inconsistency in testimony
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Extraterritorial application of Canadian refugee law
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Cumulative effect of contradictions undermined reliability
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Findings supported by record and within acceptable range
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of corroboration and internal inconsistencies

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to demonstrate state protection efforts
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Burden to prove state protection unavailable
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Applicants did not report threats to Mexican authorities
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Claim rejected due to unavailability of state protection not proven
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to show state unable or unwilling to protect
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Failure to seek help undermines claimed fear
Crimes.Legal_Rule: State protection must be reasonably available and effective
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to raise issue of state protection during hearing
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Claim failed due to lack of state protection argument
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Applicants had opportunity to present evidence
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Absence of police reports or government complaints
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Argued state protection ineffective in Mexico
Crimes.Court_Result: No error found in Board’s assessment
Crimes.Legal_Rule_Source: UNHCR Guidelines, jurisprudence (e.g., Li v. Canada)
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Did not engage with state protection mechanisms
Crimes.Resolution_Mechanism: Administrative appeal followed by judicial review
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Failure to meet refugee definition due to available protection
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Applicants must take reasonable steps to access state protection

Crimes.Crime_Name: Omission of crucial information in Personal Information Form
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Effect of omitting key facts from PIF on credibility
Crimes.Application_Facts: Mr. Quintero Cienfuegos omitted being sought by Toribio due to fraud knowledge
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Decision upheld – omission justified credibility concern
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Failed to disclose material fact known prior to departure
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of retaliation from PRI-linked individuals
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Timing and significance of omitted information
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Late disclosure of critical detail during hearing
Crimes.Application_Basis: Refugee protection claim based on political opinion
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Material omissions can support adverse credibility findings
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to include known threat in official form
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Risk of harm alleged but not credibly established
Crimes.Cause_Description: Knowledge of electoral fraud leading to threats
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Board allowed to infer lack of candor from omission
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPR s. 101(1)(a) – Duty of honesty in applications
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: N/A – claimant never lawfully resident in Canada
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: PIF treated as primary source of initial disclosure
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Omission contradicted later testimony and damaged plausibility
